presetPlanItem.description: 1. Identify the requirements for the selected data mining technique in terms of the data structure, data types, file format, data size, and quality.

customisedPlanItem.description: 1. Identify the requirements for the selected data mining technique in terms of the data structure, data types, file format, data size, and quality.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.

presetPlanItem.description: 2. Identify the data acclimatisation procedures, which must be applied to the targeted data, in order to make it suitable for the selected data mining technique. The details of these procedures have been discussed in chapter~\ref{chap:Development} (see section~\ref{subsect:DataAcclimatisation}.

customisedPlanItem.description: 2. Identify the data acclimatisation procedures, which must be applied to the targeted data, in order to make it suitable for the selected data mining technique. The details of these procedures have been discussed in chapter~\ref{chap:Development} (see section~\ref{subsect:DataAcclimatisation}.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 3. The data acclimatisation procedures must be carried out in light of the defined process objectives and to fulfil those precise objectives intended by the selected data mining modelling technique(s).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 3. The data acclimatisation procedures must be carried out in light of the defined process objectives and to fulfil those precise objectives intended by the selected data mining modelling technique(s).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 5. The data acclimatisation procedures must be adequate, sufficient and comprehensive to cover all the data required for model building, training and testing.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The data acclimatisation procedures must be adequate, sufficient and comprehensive to cover all the data required for model building, training and testing.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The data acclimatisation procedures must not influence the data through twisting, drifting, or changing their meanings, and must not cause problems, gaps, or loses of information.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The data acclimatisation procedures must not influence the data through twisting, drifting, or changing their meanings, and must not cause problems, gaps, or loses of information.

presetPlanItem.description: 3. Identify the requirements of the data acclimatisation procedures.

customisedPlanItem.description: 3. Identify the requirements of the data acclimatisation procedures.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.

presetPlanItem.description: 4. Perform the identified acclimatisation procedures and record their purpose and description.

customisedPlanItem.description: 4. Perform the identified acclimatisation procedures and record their purpose and description.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Acclimatise the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Acclimatise the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.

presetPlanItem.description: 5. In the case of compound modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN, the following steps should be carried out for each of the sub-models involved:(a) The data is acclimatised for the first sub-modelling technique in the sequence, e.g. PCA; (b) The sub-model is built and evaluated; (c) The output of the sub-modelling are forwarded towards the next phase (model building) after performing the necessary procedure and activities to acclimatise and prepare the data to suit the requirement of the main model and achieve its objectives (In the case of multiple sub-modelling, the last model in the sequence is treated as the main model, and the steps a-c is repeated for each of the sub-models);

customisedPlanItem.description: 5. In the case of compound modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN, the following steps should be carried out for each of the sub-models involved:(a) The data is acclimatised for the first sub-modelling technique in the sequence, e.g. PCA; (b) The sub-model is built and evaluated; (c) The output of the sub-modelling are forwarded towards the next phase (model building) after performing the necessary procedure and activities to acclimatise and prepare the data to suit the requirement of the main model and achieve its objectives (In the case of multiple sub-modelling, the last model in the sequence is treated as the main model, and the steps a-c is repeated for each of the sub-models);

objectivesList.presetDescription: 8. Acclimatisation should consider selecting more than one technique (compound modelling) which involves sub-modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN. Sub-modelling should be performed iteratively within the boundaries and context of data acclimatisation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 8. Acclimatisation should consider selecting more than one technique (compound modelling) which involves sub-modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN. Sub-modelling should be performed iteratively within the boundaries and context of data acclimatisation.

presetPlanItem.description: 6. Decide the data splitting strategy which will be used to choose the model testing data, e.g. holdout, bootstrap, random sub-sampling, validation and cross-validation.

customisedPlanItem.description: 6. Decide the data splitting strategy which will be used to choose the model testing data, e.g. holdout, bootstrap, random sub-sampling, validation and cross-validation.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. Prepare the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. Prepare the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Acclimatise the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Acclimatise the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.

presetPlanItem.description: 7. Split the data according the decided strategy to obtain the data which will be used in model testing.

customisedPlanItem.description: 7. Split the data according the decided strategy to obtain the data which will be used in model testing.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. Prepare the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. Prepare the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.
